intro: Blaeria sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower blaeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Blaeria sessiliflora is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
